meanings.definition: A group of naturally occurring carbohydrates.
meanings.sent1: Inositols are found in fruits and grains.
meanings.sent2: The nutritionist recommended increasing inositols intake for a balanced diet.
meanings.sent3: Why did the cookie go to school? To learn about inositols!
meanings.sent4: Her smile was as sweet as inositols on a summer day.
meanings.sent5: The inositols in the bloodstream act as messengers for the cells.

meanings.sent1: The sugar-free gum contains inositols for sweetness.
meanings.sent2: Inositols are commonly used as sugar substitutes in diabetic products.
meanings.sent3: Why did the dentist love inositols? They're easy on the teeth!
meanings.sent4: His laughter rang out like the taste of inositols on the tongue.
meanings.sent5: The inositols in the drink gave it a pleasant, mild flavor.

meanings.definition: Compounds that are important for cell signaling.
meanings.sent1: Inositols play a crucial role in transmitting signals within cells.
meanings.sent2: Cell biologists study the function of inositols in cellular communication.
meanings.sent3: Why did the smartphone need inositols? To improve its signal strength!
meanings.sent4: The inositols acted as messengers, delivering vital information to the cells.
meanings.sent5: The scientist discovered a new pathway for inositols to enhance cell signaling.
